physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Necrosis and infection of the right forefoot due to vascular disease. Amputation of the hallux was performed initially, and intravenous antibiotics were administered.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Infection could not be controlled, leading to the decision to perform an additional amputation.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Ankle-brachial index calculated; perfusion pulsatile and adequate to support healing.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Preoperative contrast arteriography showed diffuse arteriosclerotic lesions, good collateral circulation, and an intact posterior tibial artery.
Good clinical result noted; no need for a temporary prosthesis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient successfully rehabilitated, using a definitive clamshell prosthesis for outdoor activities and crutches indoors.
